title: Checkout.com rides financial technology wave to grow revenues to $74m
text:
Revenues at e-commerce firm Checkout.com rose to $74m (£60m) in 2018 as the London-headquartered business signed deals with other financial technology businesses.

The start-up connects merchants to other payment companies and provides the payment platforms for customers including Deliveroo, Samsung and Adidas.

Checkout.com’s 2018 accounts which are due to be published this week show revenue growth in Europe of 60pc in 2018, up from $46m for the previous year.

Net profits dropped 64pc, however. They fell to $2.3m, down from $6.6m in 2017.

Chief executive Guillaume Pousaz said the business was benefiting from other banking start-ups’ expansion around the world.
